Title: Gov Abiodun warns traditional rulers against allocating land to strangers
Summary: Governor Dapo Abiodun of Ogun State sounded a warning to traditional rulers found culpable of allocating land or signing unauthorised land agreements to strangers . He warned traditional rulers that they would face sanctions and the full wrath of the law .

Title: Lakurawa’s Expanding Shadow: governance, coercion, and religious manipulation in Northwest Nigeria
Summary: Lakurawa’s Expanding Shadow: governance, coercion, and religious manipulation in Northwest Nigeria . As I sat with the man I had come to see, two Lakurwa fighters approached us . They questioned my identity, and I was introduced as his brother, a trader from Sokoto .

Title: NDLEA arrests social media influencer, partner over cannabis-laced sweets in Edo
Summary: NDLEA arrested Praise Nwogu and Ebong Emem Oghosa in connection with cannabis-laced confectioneries . The arrests were made by the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) in Edo .

Title: Reps Southeast caucus urges Tinubu to pardon Nnamdi Kanu
Summary: Southeast Caucus urges President Bola Tinubu to grant a political and humanitarian pardon to the detained leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Mazi Nnamdi Kanu . The Southeast Caucus of the House of Representatives has appealed to the president to exercise his constitutional powers .

Title: Nigeria’s climate health future needs resilience, data – Expert
Summary: Nigeria is facing rising climate-health challenges from severe floods and heatwaves to increasing waterborne and vector-borne diseases . Environmental Health Specialist and climate researcher, Oluwaferanmi Akinyemi, speaks with The Guardian on how resilience, data-driven systems, equity, and equity, are needed .

Title: Insecurity: Police warn against fake news, urge citizens to report criminals
Summary: CP Baba Azare issued the warning on Monday during a high-level stakeholders’ security meeting at the command headquarters in Uyo . Azare called for collaborative efforts to combat crime in Akwa Ibom .

Title: ‘I must remain true to my values’ – Olivia Yacé resigns as Miss Universe Africa
Summary: Miss Côte d’Ivoire Universe 2025, Olivia Yacé, has announced her resignation as Miss Universe Africa and Oceania . She won the title during the coronation night of Miss Universe 2025 in Bangkok .

Title: TETFund is positioning tertiary education to thrive in digital world – Masari
Summary: TETFund is positioning tertiary education in a way for it to thrive in digital world . Chairman of the Board of Trustees of the Tertiary Education Trust Fund, Rt. Hon. Aminu Bello Masari . Masari said this is necessary because the future of education is digital .

Title: Multi-source intelligence crucial for national security – Senator Lawan
Summary: Former Senate President and current Chairman of the Senate Committee on Defence, Senator Ahmad Lawan (APC, Yobe North) stressed the importance of adopting innovative, multi-dimensional intelligence approaches to address Nigeria’s evolving security threats .

Title: Girls Abductions: Idris asks Tinubu to rejig Nigeria’s security architecture
Summary: Governor Nasir Idris of Kebbi State has called on President Bola Tinubu to review the country’s security architecture . Idris stressed that with recent security developments, there are enemies attempting to scuttle the democracy the nation currently enjoys .
